reviewText: Okay this game was short and sweet filing a nice gap of time of around two hours and chimed in some thinking at key plot points of the game which was carried along by some chessy and some actualy funny jokes as time went on. I like that this game is free even though I would still buy it at around ¬£0.99 but nothing more than that because of the length of it, which leads the game downwards however it does have replayability with the choices of jokes and a chance to get all of the points in the game and I'm not sure if there are multiple ending as I have only played it through once but although I'd like to hope so.\n\nIn essence this game has a large focus on an aspiring comedic star and the bumps and turns of a comedian itself and trying to find insperation within the real world and depending on how you play it failing miserbly or making your dreams come true, (I think) this is a nice 8-bit game as well however the audio is less tuned and background noice can be heard in some parts when the voices both cut in and out other than this I would say this is one of the best free games steam has to offer.
voteText: 34 of 44 people (77%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: Comedy Quest s a decent point and click adventure game, Its voiced and everything so that is neat. The game itself can run pretty terribly though and has some weird quirks, like resolution issues, sped up dialog and mouse sensitivity. Overall though if you dont experience those, or can work through them, you will find a decent game.
voteText: 18 of 22 people (82%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText: Just finished my first playthrough.  It was a cool little game with some clever voice acting and some good funny dialog - all for the sake of Questing for Comedy!  It doesn't take long to play it front to back, and you can save your game to go back and try new jokes, new responses to situations, or new endings.  Overall it was a lot of fun to play, and I will certainly try for a different ending!\n\nDefinitely worth the download and is more fun than a lot of games you have to pay for.  Great work on this game, and thanks for making it free!
voteText: 11 of 13 people (85%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: It's not just your usual point & click game, ergo pointing and clicking on objects, but it takes a different approach to this genre. The whole concept of the game was rather short & sweet; as it focuses on making choices made by you, the protagonist. The whole art & style of the game had a rather fetching retro feel to it, otherwise it would be bland and tedious. The humour was quite cheesy as I felt as though it took a more australian approach towards their wittiness. In contrary, There were some dull moments where your objective was to repetitively hand out fliers - it made it seem as though I had nothing better to do.\n#AustralianBanter

reviewText:
This is a short little point and click game. It's not great, but there were some fun lines and ideas.

Pros

- Interesting concept
- Voice acting
- fourth wall jokes

Cons

- Repetitive
- annoying cat asking for food every two seconds (chapter 1)
- feels random (your choices are blind)
- some horrible voice acting (like the guy who says yeahhh all the time)

So, is it worth your time? I think so, especially if you'd like to play something different. And it's not like you're going to spend any money on it, so try it and see it for yourself.

reviewText:
Love it, very nostalgic.
Edit: first review this game has received so I'll go into a bit more detail.
It reminds me of the old visual remakes of command line games, and plays like that. Where it waits for you to do things before generating any new changes.
The way the stage works is pretty good, it has kinda vague descriptions of the jokes you will perform, which makes it kinda hard to choose how something will go, like things i thought would be funny based on the description were poorly worded/performed. Even with that, its a great game and even that aspect is reminiscent of how difficult and frustrating these style of games were when they were all that was around.
Well done Grothers, love it and cant wait to see more content from you.

reviewText: Comedy quest is an interesting point 'n click game in which you play as The kid"
date: a young man entering the world of stand up comedy trying to become the best stand up comedian of all time. The game isn't your average point 'n click but it revolves around the choices YOU make unlike most games in the genre. Its a short but very fun game with brilliant voice acting and funny dialouge. It has some interesting mechanics that make the game charming and its better than a lot of the free games on the platform. There's also replay value due to choices affecting how the story and some conversations go which can result in different endings which are definitely worth replaying for if you enjoyed the game! While I definitely think its short length is a positive as it doesnt drag on It would've been really cool if it was a bit longer as I feel some parts were kinda rushed and you aren't given a chance to learn about the world more and the rest of the characters aren't considered too important which is a shame considering I really liked some of the characters and found the parts in which you got to hang out with them pretty funny! Though this doesn't take anything away from the game at all if all you're looking for is a short game that will give you a laugh."

reviewText: There are some pretty funny moments, but also some that kind of hit the mark. Much like the sets your character performs. I suppose I would reccomend this game, especially to fans of old school point-and-clicks. It's a good omage to old games like King's Quest and The Secret of Monkey Island, but with modern elements like voice acting added in. It's not the best game, but It's short and It's free so give it a try.

reviewText: Personally, the game is alright. Nothing special. One of the biggest issues I've had with it is that if you hold down the arrow keys to move, the player just twitches his leg. I would like an update that would fix this issue. Also, the game feels kinda choppy, with the animations feeling sort of strange and not as smooth as they should be. I suggest adding more frames to the walking animations. Overall, the game isn't quite bad, and if you want a game to kill time, I suggest you get this. My final review is a 7/10. Hopefully these problems will be resolved in the next build.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
What a cracking little adventure.

Okay so the graphics are a bit crappy (when you parody Monkey Island 20 years later your graphics are worse.. ) and the sound / voice acting is somewhat muffled and the click detection janky.

But you know what.. theres a lot of heart here. The jokes are terrible but its done with sincerity and it made me smile a lot and want to progress. The fully voice acted plot was great and unexpected, so bravo.. give us more... and more bug fixes.

What cut me short was my chracter inability to move during the taxi chase (possibly a windowed application issue) he just move a little then just stop, especially when moving north or south.

reviewText: Fun enough point-n-click. Lots of replay potential due to missed points (I was almost 100 points lower than the max scoreable the first time I finished the game) and alternate endings. There's a good mix of simple adventure puzzles and having to make the right choices during your character's stand-up shows. There's even a fun taxi chase and an easter egg! Highly recommended, especially if you like lame jokes.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Comedy Quest is a short point and click adventure about some schmuck who's trying to become a stand-up comic.
I've got kind of mixed feelings on this one.

On the one hand, the controls are pretty clunky, the sounds are kind of annoying, and the voice acting, while decent, is poorly recorded and you can often hear background noise when the voiceclips play.

On the other hand, the humor is solid and the art style is unique and interesting despite its somewhat mediocre quality. Most importantly, the game itself is enjoyable. And, it's so short that there's really not enough time for its bad points to start to get on your nerves. I was mildly annoyed at first but within like ten minutes i was laughing too hard to care. Though it's not for everyone, and it's certainly a tough call, the scales tip on the side of my recommending it.

...Also, my new favorite line from any game is now Crumpets
date: you are one hell of a unicorn for someone with no heart.""

reviewText: When I opened the game, I didn't expect a Leisure Suit Larry-styled game. After playing through about 2-3 hours of hilarity, 4th wall breaking and references, I got the Solid rank". I will definitely be trying this game out on stream again
date: soon. This is a well made game you've got here and "None Shall Pass" up the opportunity of playing it."

reviewText: A quick game with a few witty jokes, and a few bad puns. An upcoming comedian hopes to gain fame by doing stand up. You have to use your notebook to find objects in the world to make jokes at. Depending on whether or not you find them affects your performance. Overall, a quick game that shouldn't take a lot of time, but plays like an old school adventure game. Adventure Game Studio may be old, but it still holds up to indie developers.

reviewText:
Bullet points   Jokes are hit or miss, but that's mostly intentional
Fairly short (about two hours for an initial play-through)
A few bugs, but nothing terribly game-breakingFull review
The core concept of Comedy Quest is solid; the puzzle logic is good (I don't remember any where the solution seemed stupid after the fact) and the comedy is good for the most part.  The thing about the jokes is that a lot of them are intentionally eye-rollers; the idea is that when you earn" a good joke by finding it in the environment (remember
date: at the end of the day this is a point-and-click adventure) it stands out among the others.  This means that the better (or
hoursPlayed: simply more thorough) you are at canvassing the environment
voteText: the better the in-game jokes will be.\n\nThe one real complaint I have about the game isn't actually with the game itself
helpfulPercent: per se; it's the engine.  It's either trying so hard to recreate nostalgia that it fails to modernize
votesHelpful: or it actually is an engine from an earlier time that hasn't matured.  It's functional
votesFunny: but after having played other point-and-clicks I guess I've been spoiled by vastly superior inventory management.  Also
commentsCount: there's an issue (I won't quite call it a bug
column16: since it might just be an unfortunate coincidence) with hitting Shift-Tab to bring up the Steam overlay that causes the inventory display to go all wonky.*\n\nAt the end of the day
column17: it's a fun little indie game if you remember what it is
column19: and don't hold the low production values against it.  I quoted one of the jokes to my friend as I was playing the game: with a joke at least that good in a free game
column20:
it's certainly worth the price of admission (your time).




* Side note: if you hit this issue
column21: I found that some combination of holding down Esc and clicking on the different action buttons (at the bottom of the inventory window) does seem to eventually unstick it.\n\nIf you like this game
